linkedInData.summary:
Frank is a co-founder of Comprehensive Financial Solutions (CFS) and holds a B.S. from Elizabethtown College (Elizabethtown, PA). He is a Registered Representative and Investment Advisor Representative through Cetera Advisors LLC. Frank has over 38 years of experience in the financial services and insurance industry. He specializes in risk management, allocation strategies, and developing adequate investment income for retirees. Frank is a State of Maryland licensed insurance agent (Health, Life, and Variable). In his time away from the office, Frank enjoys fishing, boating, hunting, and cooking.

Securities and advisory services offered through Cetera Advisors LLC, member FINRA/SIPC, a broker/dealer and a Registered Investment Adviser. Cetera is under separate ownership from any other named entity.
950 Mount Hermon Road
Salisbury, MD 21804

linkedInData.summary:
Strategic driver of billions of dollars in asset growth with focus on client servicing and retention for globally diversified asset managers with experience managing institutional investment sales and client servicing roles in the institutional investment management industry. 

Define consultant relationships and deepen client relationships to optimize institutional portfolios with marketing new and existing firm portfolio strategies.


SUCCESS INDICATORS

Opportunity Analysis & Market Penetration
• $1 billion in new assets gained as part of small-cap growth fund rebuilding effort over 24-month period by guiding on-site due diligence meetings with key decision-makers at multiple consulting firms. 

• Eliminated use of largest competitor’s product from platform by helping to create and grow firm’s internal lifecycle fund product from zero assets to greater than $10 billion in three years (now $30+B in asset total). 

• Generated initial $2 billion in assets ultimately leading to $8 billion in assets, by developing a track record among Consultants and Plan Sponsors with a focus on marketing and promoting a new international small cap asset class. 

• $3.5 billion asset increase achieved in three years by educating internal teams on the value and competitive advantages of the company’s investment products in the marketplace.

Company / Product Branding & Communications
• 100% new asset growth in large cap growth product over 18 months realized by conducting one-on-one meetings with senior leadership to communicate current brand value. 

Asset Analysis, Acquisition & Retention
• 95% of clients and firms assets maintained in a significant period of flagship product underperformance through rigorous communication and meetings to share research and explain market variances and effects to portfolios. 

Strategic / Tactical Planning & Execution
Business Startups / Restructurings / Divestitures
linkedInData.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

position.title: Senior VP Marketing, Consultant Relations/Client Services
position.description:
Institutional money management firm focusing on growth equities with $17 billion in total assets. 

Oversee all institutional marketing and client investment services supporting new asset growth spanning from Chicago to Northwest, West, and Southwest regions. Collaborate with five-member team and report to three major equity partners. Accountable for new business development, portfolio specialist / territory management, and business presentations to both new and existing clients. 

Selected Achievements
Played key role in growing firm’s assets from $4 billion to $17 billion in four-year period achieved by:
• $1 billion in new assets gained as part of small-cap growth fund rebuilding effort over 24-month period by guiding on-site due diligence meetings with key decision-makers at multiple consulting firms.
• 100% new asset growth in large cap growth product over 18 months realized by conducting one-on-one meetings with senior leadership to communicate current brand value.

In addition:
• 95% of client / firm assets maintained in a significant period of flagship product underperformance through rigorous communication and meetings to share research and explain market variances and effects to portfolios.
• Added $700 million in new assets by working in collaboration with clients to develop and implement investment product solutions geared to meet their financial needs.
• $4 million in revenue generated through expanding depth of client’s use of firms multiple equity and hedge products.

multiLocaleTitle.en_US: Senior VP Marketing, Consultant Relations/Client Services

position.title: Director, Senior Portfolio Investment Specialist
position.description:
PGI designs and delivers investment solutions through a diverse group of specialized investment boutiques that comprise its $250 billion asset management business. 

Executed market and customer-service strategies that impacted company’s equity, fixed income and real estate asset growth. Founded, trained and developed group to work with existing clients both externally and with other company client-facing teams to market and promote investment / retirement products. 

Selected Achievements
• Eliminated use of largest competitor’s product from platform by helping to create and grow firm’s internal lifecycle fund product from zero assets to greater than $10 billion in three years (now $30+B in asset total).

• $3.5 billion asset increase achieved in three years by educating internal teams on the value and competitive advantages of the company’s investment products in the marketplace.

• Increased client retention by leading a team in the education of clients of improvements in portfolio performance that drove client dollar investment from 40 cents on the available investment dollar to 75 cents over two years.

• Successfully educated and serviced 50% of all nationwide sales and client service teams through regular weekly travel and delivery of presentations to clients and the clients of field teams.

• Rebuilt firm’s credibility in the marketplace by founding, training and coaching a new team on company’s sophisticated investment research process and philosophy to share with marketplace.

position.title: Founding Partner, Institutional Marketing & Client Services
position.description:
Highly regarded, systematic, original research-driven global asset-management company. 

Served as Founding Partner responsible for institutional marketing and client services, interfacing with Fortune 500 plan sponsors and global consultant community. Accountable for educating Global Pension community and consultants on investment research of a new separate asset class. 

Developed and delivered business presentations / client meetings in collaboration with Portfolio Managers. Tracked and managed business resources for startup. 

Selected Achievements
• Generated initial $2 billion in assets ultimately leading to $8 billion in assets, by developing a track record among Consultants and Plan Sponsors with a focus on marketing and promoting a new international small cap asset class.

• $500 million in new small cap assets raised in two years to launch new business operation through clear and persistent presentation to pension funds and industry consultants.

• Billions in firm-wide assets generated by developing and marketing original research to educate and create brand identity to overcome market resistance for newly formed firm.

• Developed and implemented a strategy to sell and market offshore equity fund to European hedge fund community consisting of London, Zurich, and Geneva private banks.

• Recognized as one of top 5 “emerging” money management firms in 1996.

multiLocaleTitle.en_US: Founding Partner, Institutional Marketing & Client Services

items.title: Investment Portfolio OptionsStrategy Enables Firm to Boost Assets by $3.5 Billion
items.description:
Firm’s largest client, a subsidiary that sells and services retirement plan assets had declined 60% in three years. Needed to actively rebuild trust and credibility quickly. Despite affiliation, poor product performance, and lack of support for the subsidiary, there were very bad feelings. In addition, there was lack of trust and confidence in firm’s sales and service teams. 

Nobody internally had ever communicated products and services to the subsidiary on a consistent basis as with other money managers. As such, established and maintained new relationships by making credible, consistent on site presentations to US Retirement sales and service teams and their clients on a weekly basis throughout the US.

Increased assets $3.5 billion in three-year period and improved client retention to 96%.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: Investment Product Solutions Add $700 Million in New Assets
items.description:
Large clients with significant assets were using competitors with poor track records. Needed to identify and cross-sell investment products where opportunities existed. Challenge was trying to identify best opportunities and not overselling that could potentially damage new or existing client relationships.

Gathered information from direct meeting/phone interaction and publications to see where real opportunities existed. Set up meetings or phone calls to discuss investment product offerings as an option to assist and broaden client relationship and assets. Collaboratively developed and implemented investment solutions geared to meet the needs of individual clients.

Added $700 million in new assets.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: Marketing Research Promotes Brand Identity and Generates $1.5 Billion in Firm-Wide Assets
items.description:
Needed to drive asset growth for newly founded institutional asset management firm. New startup firms have great difficulty winning new business due to AIMR standards and use of previous track records. Risks and costs were significant to attracting new pension fund assets and gaining the trust of consultants in the first 5 years. 

Developed quantitative-based investment firm in growth equities using proprietary original research to educate and gather assets from global pension funds and consultants. Created and marketed original research to educate and create a brand with pension funds and consultants, while building track record. Used consistent strategic cold calling and mailing policy to introduce firm for onsite meetings and by phone.

Secured new assets of $1.5 billion within three years of firm’s inception

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: New Business Development Strategy Helps Firm Raise $500 Million in New Small Cap Assets
items.description:
Firm needed to acquire significant investment assets in a relatively short period of time to build and expand the business. Challenge was starting a new company with no assets, AIMR compliant track record, marketing research databases, or strategy to secure Pension Consultants.

Leveraged proven track record and reputation in small cap growth equities and experience with pension fund consultants to secure assets. Conducted systematic cold calling and onsite meetings with both pension funds directly and introductory meetings with global pension consulting firms to discuss team performance, process, and philosophy and what made company different than past and peer group in the marketplace.

Raised $500 million in new small cap assets and closed product within 2 years of inception.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: New Marketing Structure / Strategy Helps Firm Grow Small Client Base of 10 Clients to 125 Clients
items.description:
There was need for a very deep analytical research product using clean data from companies that were traded publicly within the money management community besides the typical Wall Street analyst reports. Costs were significant and there were many other options in the marketplace. Asset managers had not used soft dollars previously and that meant research budgets for new boutique products were small. 

Created marketing structure with supporting materials to cultivate and maintain business relationships with Analysts and Portfolio Managers to generate sales. Made weekly presentations nationwide to largest money management firm’s research and portfolio teams to communicate company’s product value and how to incorporate to their process internally.

Grew small and unknown client base of 10 clients to 125 of the largest institutional money management firms with a guaranteed revenue contract in 28 months of hiring.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: New Strategic Marketing Team Boosts Revenues From $750,000 to Greater than $4 Million
items.description:
There was great market demand for new dynamic investment research and use of computers to manage assets by Institutional Money Managers. In addition, there was significant competition, product cost to end-user, and a long sales cycle. Furthermore, location of Phoenix, AZ versus major financial centers and our competitors made it difficult to compete.

Hired, trained, coached, and managed a marketing team to market firm’s specialized boutique research product to Money Managers globally. Identified key initial markets and guided penetration efforts for entire team.

Grew total revenues from $750,000 to greater than $4 million in 2 years

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: Newly Developed Team and Strategic Plan Revitalizes Company Brand at 40% Under Budget
items.description:
Firm’s product performance was not competitive and provided no support. Needed to develop and implement a plan and structure / train a team to build brand to retain and gather new assets, while controlling cost of team development. Furthermore, there was previous poor product performance in conjunction with much greater competition from outside managers whom had better performance and were providing high level of client service and support.

Built and led external / internal team to deliver presentations weekly on a national basis to clients. Used public speaking seminars to tell company’s story and changes to process and philosophy. Developed new materials and incorporated Portfolio Managers to support effort – all completed within a defined budget.

Built and participated in a team that grew from zero to 12 in market share within 3 years. Successfully rebuilt brand at 40% under budget.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: One-On-One Meetings With Senor Leadership Help Firm Achieve 100% in New Asset Growth
items.description:
Firm’s brand and product growth was in decline and under pressure. Needed to rebuild and communicate company’s product brand and current offerings across global market. Challenge was that Global Consultants had not been visited in person and didn't know or understand firm’s brand or value proposition. Needed to change / align their perception with company’s brand. Another issue was that many had not had onsite visit in over five years. 

Spent 80% of time on the road meeting with key decision makers working as part of major pension consultants and research teams. Developed one-on-one meetings to explain in great detail company’s product / value proposition versus current perception. Planned and coordinated an internal marketing team to analyze and update information that was to be populated within external databases for future purposes. 

Achieved 100% in new asset growth for large cap growth products over 18 months of hiring.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: Onsite Due Diligence Meetings with Eight Different Consulting Firms Secure $1 Billion in New Assets
items.description:
Small Cap Growth Product had lost 95% of its value, $4 billion in total assets, and all clients, but one over a six-year period. Portfolio team and product were completely redone and were top performing. Many Pension Consultants and their clients had been burned badly by previous mistakes at firm and prior team in place. Trust in both product and firm was very low.

Organized and participated in onsite due diligence meetings with key decision makers working on both consulting and research teams to review previous mistakes, changes to both teams, and process. Rebuilt trust and information leading to new global opportunities with new and existing consulting firms.

Secured $1 billion in new asset growth with 8 different consulting firms over a 24-month period. Assisted in closing product to new business in that same period.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: Strategic Global Relationships Help Firm Grow Total Assets From $4 Billion to $17 Billion
items.description:
After significant new client and asset growth, company had to help parent firm understand identity and what was healthy versus a negative integration in marketplace. Challenge was that pension funds and consultants had a negative view of acquisitions and impact on performance.

Proactively scheduled onsite / in-person meetings to outline what new affiliation meant and why it was positive for each team in changing its view on acquisitions

Grew firm total assets from $4 billion to $17 billion in three years.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

items.title: Systematic Communications Strategy Generates $5 Billion in New International Small Cap Assets
items.description:
Identified and proved a new asset class for consultants to offer pension funds to invest their funds in international small cap equities based on marketing research. International small cap equities were not viewed as a separate asset class to allocate pension funds due to lack of credible research and reliable data for analysis. Firm needed to deliver and convince pension plans and their respective consultants that company’s research was credible and these companies would diversify risk and add value / returns to their pension plans.

International small cap equities required great communication of original research in conjunction with onsite meetings. Implemented a systematic communication strategy to industry leaders in person, by phone, public speaking, and conference forums. Built credibility among largest plan sponsors and consultants.

International small cap was the best performing asset class in the last decade with billions of new pension assets secured including $5 billion to the firm.

contributors.headline: Partner, Senior Client Relationship Manager at William Blair Investment Management, LLC.

linkedInData.summary:
Our mission at Urban Wealth Management Group is to provide our clients with the autonomy to live lives of their own design, using all of their assets to fulfill their dreams and follow their passions.

Our mission grew from recognizing that for many decades, women—and especially women of color— have been underserved within the financial services industry, both as clients and professionals. We are proactive in leading the industry by serving the needs of an underserved group.

Our firm is built to help women connect with their own goals by understanding how their finances can grow to support the lifestyle they aspire to lead. We are driven by a fierce commitment to lead by example and change the financial services industry by building a team that looks like the people it wants to serve.

We aspire for our clients to move out of neutral and become brave and strategic about their money and their investments. We want all of our clients to have the confidence to build flexible plans and master vital tools on the road to becoming financially savvy that are tailored to them.

Our mantra: “It’s never too late.” There is always an opportunity to start fresh and keep moving forward. You simply don’t have to do it alone, join our mission by becoming a client!
linkedInData.headline: Founder,CEO -- Urban Wealth Management Group. Financial Trailblazer, Marquis Who's Who Awardee, 5-Star Professional since 2012

position.title: Founder/CEO, Wealth Advisor
position.description: At Urban Wealth Management, we help our clients get their financial lives in gear! We focus on the unique financial and economic challenges that busy professionals face. Simplifying and demystifying financial jargon is our goal.  In addition, we focus on the unique financial challenges that women face. Did you know that in the next decade, women will control nearly 2/3 of this country's wealth? Our mission is to ensure that women are prepared for that responsibility and can feel confident about making sound financial decisions for themselves,  their loved ones and their communities.

linkedInData.summary:
Hugh Anderson is a Managing Director at HighTower based in Las Vegas, Nevada.

A native of Long Island, New York, Anderson brings over 33 years of experience in the financial services industry to his clients. Hugh is dedicated to providing his clients with knowledgeable insight and uniquely contrarian investment strategies. He is an avid market, economic and geo-political watcher. His focus is finding creative perspectives that go against conventional wisdom and profiting from those discoveries. He prides himself on being able to communicate even the most complex concepts in terms any audience can understand.

He has extensive experience consulting to non-profit organizations as well as a member of board leadership. He spends a considerable amount of time in both capacities. As an accredited Investment Fiduciary he understands the challenges non-profit organizations face in managing thier resources effectively.

Hugh is an Accredited Investment Fiduciary, a Certified Financial Planner, a Certified Investment Management Analyst (CIMA) as well as a Chartered Financial Consultant (ChFC). He is also a member of the Market Technician’s Association and Association of Fundraising Professionals. He holds a Bachelor's of Arts and MBA from Hofstra University in New York. 

A Las Vegas resident since 1984, Hugh is active in the community. He has served as Chairman of the Las Vegas Metro Chamber of Commerce, St. Rose Dominican Hospital Community board and the Nevada Council on Economic Education. He currently serves as Chairman of the government affairs committee for the Las Vegas Metro Chamber of Commerce, is Chair of the St. Rose Dominican Health Foundation and a member of the Smith Center Board of Advisors.

linkedInData.summary:
Contact Information: 502-235-6452; ken_mathis@outlook.com. 

Ken has been in his current role since March 2012. In that time, Hardy Reed has organically grown from $250 million in AUM to approximately $4 billion in AUM/AUA/Fiduciary Services. Hardy Reed has been CEFEX Certified for 11 consecutive years, named FT Top 300 in 2020 & 2019, RIA Channel Top 100 in 2019, and RIA Magazine Top 50 Fastest Growing RIAs in 2019 and 2014.

As a senior executive in the financial services industry, Ken has led fiduciary consulting, investment advisory, asset management, wealth management, and investment consulting organizations. 

Ken was recently elected as a board member of the Center of Board Certified Fiduciaries and is a Speciality Leader in the areas of Foundations and Endowments and ESG. He has also contributed to CEFEX’s Consultant’s Assessment of Fiduciary Excellence for nonprofits and fi360’s fiduciary training program for foundations and endowments. He served as Chairperson of the first CEFEX Foundation Committee. Ken has written numerous whitepapers on fiduciary best practices for institutional organizations. In addition, he has been a speaker at national conferences on fiduciary best practices, fiduciary assessments and CEFEX Certification.

Ken has completed the Pension and Investment Management Program at Wharton School of Business, University of Pennsylvania. He has earned the Accredited Investment Fiduciary Analyst® (AIFA®) professional designation from fi360 through the Katz School of Business, University of Pittsburgh. He has also received the Professional Plan Consultant® (PPC®) professional designation from fi360 through the Robert Morris University. Ken is also a CEFEX Analyst, having received formal training in investment fiduciary responsibility and met the criteria established by the Centre for Fiduciary Excellence (CEFEX). He received a B.B.A. from the Fogelman College of Business and Economics at the University of Memphis.

Ken is past Chairperson of Neighborhood Housing Opportunities, part of The Memphis Leadership Foundation. He has also been a volunteer, summer staff and club leader for Young Life (British Columbia, TN and CO).
linkedInData.headline: Accredited Investment Fiduciary Analyst® (AIFA®), Board Certified Fiduciary™ (BCF™), Professional Plan Consultant® (PPC®), CEFEX Analyst

The PPC™ - Professional Plan Consultant™ designation signifies a commitment to service excellence in the retirement industry and is awarded to those that complete a curriculum based on ERISA regulations and industry best practices as it pertains to the management of a qualified plan. The PPC™ designation is sponsored by Financial Service Standards, and accredited by Robert Morris University.

position.title: Founding Member and Specialty Leader
position.description:
Specialty Leader in Foundations and Endowments and ESG

The Center for Board Certified Fiduciaries (CBCF) is a Public Benefit Corporation founded and funded by leading fiduciary advocates.

CBCF’s stated mission is to:

Provide the critical infrastructure to accelerate the development of exemplary fiduciaries.

Board certify fiduciary professionals in one of ten areas of specialization.

Affiliate with leading universities to provide an executive education certificate in fiduciary leadership, stewardship, and governance. Over time, develop the curricula for the first Masters and Ph.D. programs with a concentration in fiduciary responsibility.

Conduct and publish research on fiduciary standards and associated best practices.

Foster procedures and best practices associated with the role of the Outsourced Fiduciary Officer (OFO).

Provide expert advice to regulators and SROs on how to raise the quality of their published fiduciary standards.

Convene and host conferences and workshops for both professional and lay-fiduciaries.

fullPositions.title: Founding Member and Specialty Leader
fullPositions.description:
Specialty Leader in Foundations and Endowments and ESG

The Center for Board Certified Fiduciaries (CBCF) is a Public Benefit Corporation founded and funded by leading fiduciary advocates.

CBCF’s stated mission is to:

Provide the critical infrastructure to accelerate the development of exemplary fiduciaries.

Board certify fiduciary professionals in one of ten areas of specialization.

Affiliate with leading universities to provide an executive education certificate in fiduciary leadership, stewardship, and governance. Over time, develop the curricula for the first Masters and Ph.D. programs with a concentration in fiduciary responsibility.

Conduct and publish research on fiduciary standards and associated best practices.

Foster procedures and best practices associated with the role of the Outsourced Fiduciary Officer (OFO).

Provide expert advice to regulators and SROs on how to raise the quality of their published fiduciary standards.

Convene and host conferences and workshops for both professional and lay-fiduciaries.

linkedInData.summary:
Robert Bjork, Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Birch Cove Group, Ltd., is a Certified Financial Planner® professional and a Registered Principal of Raymond James Financial Services, Inc. He started his career in the financial services industry in 1981, first as a solo practitioner and then in partnerships to best serve his clients.

Today, Robert’s practice revolves around diligent investment management and personal financial planning for high net worth individuals. He currently manages 80 active financial plans, including client and estate assets.

Robert is a lifelong Twin Cities resident. He lives in Plymouth with his wife Beth, a consulting physical therapist, and their three children. Robert is actively involved in his church community, is a volunteer board member for nonprofits, and an avid golfer. He also enjoys reading and travel.

honors.title: Top Wealth Managers
honors.description: Nominees are vetted on criteria such as assets managed, revenues, length of service in the industry, number and types of professional certifications, and record of regulatory compliance and complaints. Researchers check candidates' compliance records and assign weighted score to any infractions they discover. They also factor in advisers professional achievements and charitable work and philanthropy. Portfolio performance is not a criterion because client portfolios vary and are typically unaudited. Another reason not to factor returns into the ranking is that advisers are judged on how well they serve their clients' needs, and focusing on returns would unfairly penalize advisors who handle very conservative investors, and vice versa. Instead, researchers focus on clients satisfaction and client retention. Revenues raised by the advisor are considered a measure of client satisfaction, because clients are likely to hire a successful advisor to manage more assets or perform additional services.

linkedInData.summary:
With nearly 40 years in financial services, Matthew joined the industry in 1981. Prior to joining Barnum Financial Group, Matt worked for Prudential as a Financial Advisor and Mass Mutual as an Assistant General Agent, District Manager, and Senior Associate. Matt was also a course moderator for Life Underwriters Training Council. He received his BS in Business Administration, majoring in Insurance from the University of Rhode Island. Subsequently, he received the Chartered Life Underwriter (CLU) designation and Chartered Financial Consultant®(ChFC®) designation from the American College. Matt is licensed to sell Life, Accident, and Health Insurance and holds the Series 6, 63 and 65 Securities Licenses. He currently resides in North Providence, Rhode Island.

I am a registered representative of and offer securities and investment advisory services through MML Investors Services, LLC., member SIPC (www.sipc.org).
Supervisory address: 6 Corporate Drive, Shelton CT 06484. 203-513-6000.
